comments.message: Hi Margaret, interesting post! Any chance you could find an image to go along with it? Images help grab attention and tell a story with higher impact. Looking forward to seeing more of your inspiring insights on OpenIDEO. Yeah. description: We have had some experience in teaching community and church leaders about trauma healing in difficult situations (e.g. CAR, South Sudan).. We have found that as they understand the results of trauma, and as they start to be healed from their own trauma, they are much more receptive to accepting and understanding new information. I would think that some major program of trauma healing, especially for leaders, in the Ebola affected countries, would increase the acceptance of information and needed procedures to bring the epidemic to a halt.
summary: Getting a frightened community to cooperate in health care areas can be very difficult. We have found that trauma healing training can make all the difference.
title: Trauma Healing Training
